graph

Class Edge

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.Edge
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DirectedEdge, UndirectedEdge

    public abstract class Edge
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class that represents an edge in a graph.

      • Edge

        public Edge(Vertex beginning,

        Creates an edge with a beginning and an end.
        Parameters:
        beginning - Vertex connected to the edge.
        end - Vertex conncted on the other side of the edge.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect(Vertex beginning,
                    Vertex end)
        Connects this edge to two new vertices.
        Parameters:
        beginning - Vertex connected to the edge.
        end - Vertex conncted on the other side of the edge.

      • setParent

        public void setParent(Graph parent)
        Sets the graph that the edge belongs to another value.
        Parameters:
        parent - The gaph the edge belongs to.

      • getParent

        public Graph getParent()
        Returns the graph the edge belongs to.
        Returns:
        The graph that contains the edge (can be null if the Edge has not been added to a graph).

      • getNeighbour

        public abstract Vertex getNeighbour(Vertex vertex)
        Giving one vertex, it gives you the neighbour.
        Parameters:
        vertex - A vertex that is connected to the edge.
        Returns:
        Null if the given vertex is null or if the edge is directed and the given vertex is at the end of the edge. Else it will return the neighbour of the given vertex.
